website_summaries.verdict: A small, low-cost machine of slightly higher capacity than others in its class.
cons: Does not handle wet branches and leaves well

customer_reviews.title: LawnMaster Chipper stopped working unexpectedly
customer_reviews.text: This LawnMaster chipper was working adequately but motor stopped after a few months of low to moderate use. We will update our review if/when the manufacturer replaces the unit according to the warranty. Unfortunately, we will likely have to ship the unit back at our expense. Based on the fact that the unit stopped working for no apparent reason (no jam, no overload, etc.), and the fact that we will likely have to ship at our expense to replace a defective unit, at this point we would not recommend or purchase this again.
customer_reviews.author: Juniper

customer_reviews.title: 1 1/2 years into using it very gently for only dry skinny twigs it died
customer_reviews.text: due to reviews that other had posted I had purchased a 2 year extended protection plan so will see how that goes. We had also bought a Sun Joe very similar shredder to test them both and as crazy as it sounds that one ALSO died the same day LawnMaster died and both just started idling slower and slower without even any wood in there, none of them got hot or started smelling or any of that, makes one wonder whether they have some built in clock that tells them when to die!
customer_reviews.author: cdr

customer_reviews.title: Do NOT Buy This!
customer_reviews.text: Don't Waste your money! Only handles the smallest of twigs It jams up and it's very difficult to clear the jam. It was so frustrating I stopped using it after one use. Spend the extra money and get a real chipper.
customer_reviews.author: T.L. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work past .25 to .5 inches
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't work as advertised. If you have small, soft wood sticks to grind up (less than a penny in diameter) it works great. If the wood is hard, or any larger, the blades can't go through it it. Also note, the instructions say it cannot be used with sticks that have leaves or pine needles on them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: LAWN MASTER? MORE LIKE LAWN LOSERS
customer_reviews.text: The box was missing the screws and R clips for the wheels We purchased it during the winter to be ready for spring, so Amazon's return date had passed. So, I called the manufacturer like the manual stated to do for missing parts. I have the rep the part numbers and, after checking his computer, he started that they didn't stock those parts and I should take it to an authorized repair shop. What BS! LawnMaster is a LawnLoser! After pleading with the Amazon rep, who for some reason had to check with a supervisor several times, they agreed to accept the return.
customer_reviews.author: Gregory K

customer_reviews.title: There are things to like about it (1) it chips (2) it can handle ...
customer_reviews.text: There are things to like about it (1) it chips (2) it can handle sticks up to 1 1/2 if fed at a reasonable rate However (1) twigs go right through (2) it doesn't shred at all Most disappointing is Lawnmaster's customer service My unit came missing the screws for the legs and the cotter pins that hold the wheels. I was told 'go head return it to Amazon' because 'we don't have any of the hardware packs in stock'. If that's the response I got for a dollar's worth of hardware for a $150 machine, I wouldn't put much stock in the manufacturer being much help with general warranty issues..
customer_reviews.author: J. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: Mulcher that compliments rake and powered handsaw with bag and push down item
customer_reviews.text: Really enjoy the ease of use of this mulcher so far so good with the push added feature to it. Used it like a charm with a rake to add mulch to the yard for have couple plants growing around that needed it. Compliments the powered handsaw by making sawdust when cutting the trees into smaller four parts to send through it. Plus the bag at the bottom comes in handy when moving around the mulch and sawdust to plants around the yard.
customer_reviews.author: Derek Allan Elj

customer_reviews.title: Jams constantly.
customer_reviews.text: This unit jams constantly. I have to keep opening and clearing the chute, even on smaller diameter twigs—what is extra annoying is having to unscrew a knob around 20 rotations to get in and clean it. ...I mean, why not just make it open with some kind of latch?! Very annoying and these factors quadruple the time it should take to mulch anything.
customer_reviews.author: Alexander J. Wallman

customer_reviews.title: Decent product.
customer_reviews.text: I haven't read the other reviews. This is a nice light duty chipper. I used it today for the first time and it worked well for 6 hours of continuous use. Chipped light branches from 3 small maples my neighbor took down. It does not do 'perfect' chips, there are some strips upto 6 inches long where it peeled rather than chipped. After flipping the blade I tested it on fresh and dry blackberry canes (the real reason I picked it up) and it chipped rather than shredded the canes. I am very pleased with the product .
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Poor shredder
customer_reviews.text: Not good. I had a Harbor Freight shredder which worked very well. It was stolen from my shed. Saw this on Amazon and looked sturdy and heavy duty.WHAT A DISSAPPOINTMENT. I purchased this last December and only used it lately.Sheds very poorly. Hard to insert branches and will minimally shred. Sharpened blade but did not help.Guess I will eat the money I paid and get one at Harbor Freight. Too late to return :(
customer_reviews.author: BUMPO

customer_reviews.title: Good if you have 1/2"-3/4" sticks to chip. That's it.
customer_reviews.text: Good if you have 1/2"-3/4" sticks to chip. That's it. After the third disassembly in about half an hour I'm ready to toss this POS. It doesn't cut 1 1/2" branches as claimed. It doesn't cut 1" branches. It doesn't cut thin branches. It doesn't cut leaves (I knew that), it doesn't like acorns. So if you can let your fallen tree lay around till all the acorns and leaves fall off and it's good and dry, and cut it all up into less than 1" thick pieces, you might be ok.
customer_reviews.author: BlueBellBlue

customer_reviews.title: Good for small brush and small lot
customer_reviews.text: Be sure to wear goggles because this sometimes ejects small pieces back from the feed chute. It handles sticks up to about 3/4" without much difficulty. For larger sticks that fit through the opening, but I've found it helps to lift and lower the stick repeatedly to keep it from bogging down. It is suitable for cleaning up shrub trimmings from our small yard.
customer_reviews.author: Gravelle Pyle

customer_reviews.title: Chipper won't even turn on after 1 day of use
customer_reviews.text: I used the chipper on very small branches in the yard for 1 day (about 3 hours of yard work) and toward the end after fixing a jam (which happens many times) the chipper would refuse to start up. I have seen this similar issue peppered throughout the review section here. Yes there is a reset button and yes I followed the instructions when it doesn't start, neither of which worked. It is a shame that spending >100 dollars on a product and it ceases to work after limited use. I will be attempting to return this item.
customer_reviews.author: An actual Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Very good chipper for small jobs, and has a small price.
customer_reviews.text: This chipper/shredder worked as expected. For an electric chipper it has plenty of power. I was able to bog it down, but it quickly recovered anything over one inch of green wood needs to be fed in slowly. I got it because the blades are easy to change and easy to sharpen (just a small lawn mower type blade). The output shoot did clog easily so keep an eye on it. One large hand screw opens the whole thing up to clean it out or change the blade. I only have two fruit trees, so this is a perfect fit for me. I also liked the Snow Joe chipper but the replacement cutting blade and counterplate were not readily available.
customer_reviews.author: DwayneG

customer_reviews.title: Makes very fine shred so if you want chips that could be ...
customer_reviews.text: This little shredder is my second of this model. I used the first so much it finally quit. But bought another because they work so hard. They handle small stuff well but you have to feed carefully. Makes very fine shred so if you want chips that could be hard to get. Pretty easy to open and service when blades need sharpening, or replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Though I didn't have great expectations for a chipper shredder priced in this range, I was pleasantly surprised by the power and efficiency. The blade doesn't ship sharpened very well so this should be the first thing you do before powering it up. The discharge shoot easily clogs with lighter dry material but is easily cleared by using the pusher tool or opening the cover to clear it. I have been mulching palm fronds and tropical plant waste and it works very well. It easily turns 1-1/2" branches into powder and wood chips. If it broke after the warranty I would replace it with the same item.
customer_reviews.author: McKenna Maritime Corp.

customer_reviews.title: was pretty blunt. These bushes were nasty so cutting softer ...
customer_reviews.text: I chopped up a huge amount of rosemary bushes and it chews them quite well. I wish the opening was bigger, because shoving bushes in can be tough, but the blade cuts through it no problem. After about 6 to 8 hours of use the blade, which I turned over, was pretty blunt. These bushes were nasty so cutting softer wood shouldn't blunt it as much. I'll have to sharpen it for the next run. Very easy to take apart and remove the blade. If the feeder opening was bigger I'ld give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amber

customer_reviews.title: the re-furbish department has some worthless employee who didn't take the time to look at the chipper or try it out.
customer_reviews.text: I had bought a returned chipper and the former customer sent it back after he had damaged it - so the chipper came to me worthless, the blade would not even cut through 1/4 inch branches. The blade was used and damaged. I happen to own a sharpening wheel and I simply sharpen the blade. Next time I need yard tools I will pay full price next time. The re-furbish department has some worthless employee who didn't take the time to look at the chipper or try it out. I took an hour a few weeks later to sharpen the blade and make sure it was put together correctly - it now works just as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I received this last week. I was looking forward to using it to grind up some branches that I recently trimmed out of the trees on my property. What a disappointment. The product description said that it could grind up to a 1-1/2 inch branch. It will not. The smaller branches just wrapped around the blade and only a few ground up. I don't know what else to say other than don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: LAB

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for Forsythia Clippings and Raspberry Canes
customer_reviews.text: My primary use for this is a much lighter workload than many others. I'm mostly using this for trimmings from a row of Forsythia bushes and two rows of raspberry canes. It does an awesome job on both. I can take a 8 foot long Forsythia branch (2/3 inch at the thickest) and it chips it in a couple seconds. The leaves aren't shredded at all. The really small end (around an 1/8 in diameter) is left in 1-3 inch long pieces. But 90% of the branch was chipped into very small pieces (1/4 inch). So far, I'm very happy.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sorensen

customer_reviews.title: This machine is GREAT...and it's priced right!
customer_reviews.text: This product is perfect for the homeowner who does annual pruning and general yard maintenance. It says "up to 1 1/2 inch diameter" and it lives up to that claim, just don't force it and you'll be fine. No it does not really pulverize leaves, but they will quickly turn into compost anyway. Used it all afternoon the first day I received it to get rid of prunings from a lilac tree, rody's and apple trees. Worked absolutely GREAT. Very pleased with the purchase. And this coming from a guy who usually rents or borrows the high powered gas versions. Know it's limitations and you'll be HAPPY!
customer_reviews.author: fotojo44

customer_reviews.title: This will not process yard waste as you hope it will
customer_reviews.text: This will not process yard waste as you hope it will. Used once then sold on craigslist. Not good at all.
customer_reviews.author: M. Speth

customer_reviews.title: Good shredder for the price
customer_reviews.text: Good for shredding small branches. If the branches are very green or wet, the shredded wood sticks inside and must be cleaned periodically. I bought this to shred annuals plants in the garden from the previous year and use them for mulch. It does what I need for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Also it's not easy to change blades and the plastic housing stopped fitting ...
customer_reviews.text: The motor and bushings failed after about two months of fairly light use--no branches more than about 1/2 inch. Also it's not easy to change blades and the plastic housing stopped fitting snugly--warping. The feed opening is strangely small; the various slots inside are also oddly made, leading to quick clogging. Overall it's badly made from low-grade plastic, very poorly designed and comes with a weak motor. Avoid at all costs. You'd do better with a strong pair of shears.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: For light duty yard word where you don't plan on using the wood chips for landscaping it does the job in reducing the size of wa
customer_reviews.text: I'm returning mine. It leaves long strips and strands of tree bark in quite a bit of the wood chips. For light duty yard word where you don't plan on using the wood chips for landscaping it does the job in reducing the size of waste. I use the wood chips to landscape my property and it just adds more work having to sift through and clean out the chips. Maybe I have higher expectations then I should for the price but I need more out of my chipper than this will deliver.
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: This "shredder" is useful on only a narrow selection of debris
customer_reviews.text: This "shredder" is useful on only a narrow selection of debris. Too thick, and it won't cut. Too thin, and it just sends it right on through. If you're mulching leaves, just stick 'em in a bag and walk on them, or crumple by hand: this thing will waste your time. If you're chipping twigs, you'll see them fly right on by the blade. Smallish pine sticks work best. But that's it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Gladfelter

customer_reviews.title: only for the perfect branches
customer_reviews.text: Used it for small branches - some dry, some rather fresh, of course with the leaves on it just became a mess - as well as vines & roots - max. thickness 3/4". Often it just ate the whole thing or kept the bark intact in one long string, which I needed to pick back out of the pile as it was meant for mulch in the yard. With the perfect branches it worked fine - dry, max 1/2" thick. Thought it'd be better than stated in the other testimonials - should've gotten a stronger one, which is also more expensive.
customer_reviews.author: Ute Miklos

customer_reviews.title: Poor performance
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this shredder based on the reviews I read and maybe my expectations were to high. The shredder was delivered timely. Assembly was very simple and took 15 minutes. Starting the shredder was very simple. However performance was far worse than I expected. I had a lot of yard waste (branches and leaves) to shred and the machine stopped working within 2 hours of work. I guess this is a decent machine if you have very minimal work to do and very minute branches. The shredder struggled with anything over 1inch and the blade got stock relatively easily. On the bright side, jams are easy to resolve. I have returned the shredder once it stopped working.
customer_reviews.author: Memosnag

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful little tool that is well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful little tool that is well worth the money. I have all these sticks and branches on my property which are difficult to handle until the semi-annual village brush clean-up day. Handles sticks up to 1 1/2 inches and anything bigger makes good campfire wood. The thing will pay for itself in what I will save in buying wood chip mulch. The collector bag is simple but effective and neat for collecting the wood chips. Once of the best yard tools I have purchased in years. For small yard sticks and branches I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for pine cones !
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to shred a ton of pine cones that are always falling from the 3 trees in the yard. You will have to remove the top part to make it work. Only remove the top if you can be very safe. Works great, even for the compact cones.
customer_reviews.author: SMP

customer_reviews.title: This is a GREAT product!
customer_reviews.text: This is a GREAT product!! Let twigs/branches dry before using. Is a bit noisy - but totally worth it to have beautiful mulch. Do you have a blower/vacuum that would be appropriate to use after when a more refined mulch is needed? for potted plants etc. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Judy D.

customer_reviews.title: Great for small yard cleanup.
customer_reviews.text: This is pure pleasure to use. Unlike the slightly less expensive chipper at Harbor Freight, you can actually get replacement blades for these from Amazon. The unit, realistically, is well tuned for slightly over 1 inch branches. Cleaning it out is a breeze and it has power in reserve. As an aside, it is useful to trim off side shoots on the branch being chipped to allow an efficient feed of the material. While it will self feed, a bit of downward pressure gets the job done quickly.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas W. Thorpe

customer_reviews.title: It is perfect for perfect branches with no side branches
customer_reviews.text: this machine is very selective in what it will chip....so it is not the total solution to your yard shredding. It says it doesn't do leaves and they really mean it. In south Florida, I am grinding up small palm fronds and they always clog the machine. It is perfect for perfect branches with no side branches. but who isn't? Also 1.5 inches is an exaggeration: it does 1 inch stuff ok. so if you have a lot of pole like branches this is for you. otherwise, something bigger is required.
customer_reviews.author: John Fuller

customer_reviews.title: What a piece of chip
customer_reviews.text: If I can rate this with 0 stars I would. This chipper is literally a Piece of Chip..... I first tried to chip some 1/2 inch to 1 inch branches. It kept shutting the chipper off. so I had to keep restarting it. Then I tried to chip some small bamboo less than 1/2 inch and that did the same exact thing This thing can't chip anything
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Broke on third day of use.
customer_reviews.text: This product broke after about 6 hours of use, spread over 3 days. The shaft that holds the blade has twisted and deformed, making the blade not align with the slotted metal disc behind it. I disassembled it to see if it is fixable, but the disc no longer fits tightly and the top of the shaft has deformed such that I am not able to put the blade back on. I do not recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Fred Kourmadas

customer_reviews.title: Does the job, blade is very heavy duty.
customer_reviews.text: The only issue that I have is that once a *dry* stick has bypassed the guide, it just kind of skips around and clanks until something else pushes it through the blade. Dry sticks are difficult to chip, anything near the advertised capacity will just vibrate and more or less turn to saw dust at a snail pace. There are no issues with wet sticks, this thing grabs them and sucks them down hungrily. Tiny stuff like twigs from a globe willow often strip and shred lengthwise, but they are quite reduced in the process.
customer_reviews.author: Dtho

customer_reviews.title: Overrated
customer_reviews.text: I was suckered in by such good reviews and a low price. You get what you pay for. Any stick or branch bigger around than your middle finger will cause this thing to jam or overheat. The good news is that the breaker trips before any long term damage is done to the motor and jams are relatively easy to fix. For very small jobs at a low price, this might be OK. For anything else, don't waste your time and money.
customer_reviews.author: T Walker

customer_reviews.title: Worst chipper I have ever tried.
customer_reviews.text: Worst chipper I have ever tried. The blades started chipping away within 30mins of use.
customer_reviews.author: R. Newman

customer_reviews.title: I wish I could justify getting a real chipper.
customer_reviews.text: As many of the other reviews say, it bogs down with higher diameter pieces of wood. I found that twisting the sticks as you push them in helps with the chipping. In general, chipping an shredding takes a long time with the lawn master. Unfortunately, a real chipper costs adds at least an extra zero to the price, so this is a good tool if you only need to do some occasional chipping.
customer_reviews.author: tdubsound

customer_reviews.title: Nice chipper for small jobs.
customer_reviews.text: perfect for small jobs; wouldn't work for large branches. We use this when we trim back our (many) trees and bushes; we chip all branches that are smaller than about 2 inches and use the shredded/chipped products to lay back under the bushes. Looks very nice. No issues in using the item.
customer_reviews.author: akm

customer_reviews.title: It's really great for the old
customer_reviews.text: It takes awhile for denser materials, but it does get them chipped up. It's really great for the old, insect-eaten wood. Like someone else said, the really small twigs just go straight through. It's a bit rougher, overall, than the mulch you'd buy, but it works for reducing large, awkward sticks that I have sitting in piles from all the tree and bush trimmings to something I can place around plants.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Worst product ever bought
customer_reviews.text: Worst product ever bought. It does not cut anything if its green. Mine broke down after 30 minutes with nothing over half inch in thickness. NOTE: AMAZON'S RETURN POLICY WAS SIMPLY OUTSTANDING!...10 STARS
customer_reviews.author: Nestaniotis

customer_reviews.title: Great on dry wood
customer_reviews.text: This chipper/shredder does not do well with green branches, especially thin ones from bushes or small trees. Did great with dry branches around an inch in diameter.
customer_reviews.author: Angel Scott

customer_reviews.title: Great for yard clean up
customer_reviews.text: I used this all spring, summer and into the fall for yard clean up. This is NOT for large branches, but does an awesome job chipping the branches of bushes and shrubbery. It is light and very easy to wheel around the yard. It comes with a heavy canvas bag to catch the debris. When putting fresh branches and sticks in it more shreds than chips, but when you put dry stuff in it chips it. I'm happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri

customer_reviews.title: Good little shredder!
customer_reviews.text: Shredder works great! We have shredded a lot of small branches with it, but find that it doesn't like to shred anything bigger than an 1" size branch. We will continue to use it because we are having numerous trees dropped on our property and it does a good job of making good chips around our flower beds and fence rows.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: bought in 2017 its 2020
customer_reviews.text: Still love it. it does shred some but i group it together in bunches and put it back through.
customer_reviews.author: jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Works great on dead yard debris and limbs
customer_reviews.text: Works great on dead yard debris and limbs. Just chews on the green debris and limbs. But I really like the machine. Easy to use and gives me useful mulch as I trim and remove dead plants
customer_reviews.author: Leola M. Holdeman

customer_reviews.title: Get a chipper with two machined blades, not stamped steel one piece like this one.
customer_reviews.text: Returned product the next day because it was completely useless as a stick chipper. Literally would not chip a 1/4 inch twig.
customer_reviews.author: Sherri F

customer_reviews.title: Worth what you pay.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little machine! It went thru a large pile of twigs and leaves over a few days. It does jam up if you are not careful about how much you put in at once. It chopped differently for different types of trees. Overall - it di a great job.
customer_reviews.author: MaryAnn Smith

customer_reviews.title: Very Good Shredder For Landscape Clippings
customer_reviews.text: We have a lot of ornamental grasses which need to be cut down in the early spring. In the past it has been a five to six day project requiring us to fill numerous trash cans. This machine worked extremely well and allowed us to do the entire job in about 6 hours and to produce good mulch. The only issue is to learn to not allow it to feed itself too fast which will cause clogging. It is easy to clear a clog however.
customer_reviews.author: ARMELIA SNYDER

customer_reviews.title: I wanted something easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I was looking for. I didn't want a big, noisy chipper for branches. I wanted something easy to maneuver, electric, and big enough for all the woody plant stems that I get from my native plant garden in the Spring cleanup. This worked perfectly. Instead of hauling away debris to the municipal yard waste site, I have roughage for my compost pile.
customer_reviews.author: kathy kwiatkowski

customer_reviews.title: Performed as Advertised
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to grind small diameter limbs and sticks and it it does just that. If you don't want to spend $700+ on a larger chipper and you are looking to do smaller limbs (1 1/2 inch diameter) this is excellent. I advise buying an extra blade when you purchase this.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Dunham

customer_reviews.title: The bolt had loctite on it!
customer_reviews.text: I used it for a day or two and it was working fine. I needed to replace the blade and could not get the bolt out. The wrench it comes with to get the screw out was almost bending in half. I could not get the right torque to pry it lose. When I finally got the bolt out I saw that it had LOCTITE on it. Now why on earth would the manufacturer's loctite a bolt that has to be removed?
customer_reviews.author: Sarah1941

customer_reviews.title: Good little chipper. Excellent value.
customer_reviews.text: Worked just fine for me. Ran some 1 1/2" branches through it, but didn't want to dull the blade so stuck to 1" and smaller. After 3 hours of chipping up branches I checked the blade. It was still sharp. The motor is very quite and assembly is a snap. This was a good buy. Very pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Capt Dan

customer_reviews.title: Epic little guy
customer_reviews.text: This little chipper works better than I expected it to! It will not take down an entire tree unless that tree was super thin, but it was able to turn a couple trees in my yard to a bag of mulch and log suitable for burning. Love this thing!!! It works better on dried leaves and branches. We have been cutting down a branch and letting it sit over night before mulching.
customer_reviews.author: RebaJane

customer_reviews.title: a chipper off the old blick
customer_reviews.text: My only problem with the product was that the wheel hubs did not quite fit one wheel. A bit of work with a mallet corrected that. Overall, I really liked the product because it was easy to assemble, was a snap to clean and had a good force feed handle to get things through the hopper when they hung up. The critter was well balanced and easy to move about the yard. If you want to hide it a golf bag cover fits over it quite niecly.
customer_reviews.author: Feldmar Twomblebee

customer_reviews.title: Seemed to work fine at first
customer_reviews.text: Seemed to work fine at first, but after a while it clogs up and is difficult to clean out the clog.
customer_reviews.author: Vicky Taylor-Gayner

customer_reviews.title: Easily chips limbs up to an inch and a half
customer_reviews.text: Chipper far exceeded my expectations. Easily chips limbs up to an inch and a half. Seems to be very durable. I cut down two large mulberry trees and chipped all the branches within the operating range. When a limb jams, the jamb can be easily cleared. the chipping blade has stayed sharp and is very efficient. I would recommend this item.
customer_reviews.author: Chief 51

customer_reviews.title: Buy something else . . .
customer_reviews.text: Today, I wheeled out this shredder, hoping it would give me a better result than the last several times that I attempted to us it. Not to be. It simply doesn't work. I feed in branches and leaves with little success. I just put it in the alley hoping someone will pick it up and figure out how to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Scott Slater Markus

customer_reviews.title: All in all this is a nice little shredder for residential use
customer_reviews.text: Works well. Have used twice fairly heavily. No problems shredding branches up to about 1 inch in diameter. I only aged the branches 2 weeks after cutting, so wood was still fairly green but leaves were dried up. Wouldn't advise feeding larger branches. Wouldn't feed fresh cut leaves either. All in all this is a nice little shredder for residential use.
customer_reviews.author: David Gough

customer_reviews.title: Bad product
customer_reviews.text: It might chip straw naybe. Worst product I've brought o. Amazon. work on really dry wood maybe if its balsa. Would not purchase it again
customer_reviews.author: Hobeyone

customer_reviews.title: For 2 hours it was great. It chopped brush to an acceptable size for ...
customer_reviews.text: For 2 hours it was great. It chopped brush to an acceptable size for bagging and was easy to collect in a standard 5 gallon bucket. After 2 hours of operation it shut down. I followed the reset instructions but after one hour still could not get it to run. Returned item.
customer_reviews.author: H NEILL

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for the price
customer_reviews.text: Chips wood. Great deal for the price. Easy to assemble. Does not mulch leaves or break up small twigs, both of which will end up in your mulch. Instructions say not to cut green wood. I'd go a step further and say not to cut branches until the leaves have dried and fallen off. If you can do that, this will probably work for you. If you have a big job and/or need to be able to throw ANY vegetation in there and have mulch come out the other side, you'll need something else.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan Richardson

customer_reviews.title: As someone who has over 17 trees on property and numerous shrubs this is perfect for chipping and shredding my regular pruning
customer_reviews.text: Having used this chipper for a few days on branches ranging from nearly the maximum size to twigs I must say that it is well worth the purchase price. Now, if you're looking for an industrial chipper/shredder: This isn't it. As someone who has over 17 trees on property and numerous shrubs this is perfect for chipping and shredding my regular pruning.
customer_reviews.author: Conway Brew

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THIS!
customer_reviews.text: Wow!!!!! I LOVE THIS!!!! Replaced a much much heavier chipper with this and absolutely love the unbelievable portability and ease of use of this product. Have used it dozens of time with yard debris/tree branches etc. WOW!!!!! GREAT machine & one of the smartest purchases I've made!
customer_reviews.author: POM

customer_reviews.title: Twigs and branches eating machine
customer_reviews.text: Buy it for twigs and branches. Leaves, I just bury under mulch. Works great
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good item
customer_reviews.text: Good product! It is electric so it struggles a little but works great for smaller limbs
customer_reviews.author: RNR5150

customer_reviews.title: OK chipper
customer_reviews.text: Great at chipping dried branches larger than 1/2". Branches that are 1/2" or less and still green either won't chip or get wrapped up around the chipping blade. Overall it's a good product for the price, but it has limitations.
customer_reviews.author: Savencash

customer_reviews.title: EAST TEXAS HOE ONER
customer_reviews.text: Great little machine with plenty of power but you need to work a little. The Lawnmaster chipped most everything put into it. It did jamb a few times but it was easy to clear. The blade sharpness lasted about four hours of constant use and had to be sharpened. Over all I am very happy with this purcace.
customer_reviews.author: Dani Echols

customer_reviews.title: Sticks, yes; leaves, no.
customer_reviews.text: Leaves have to be put in by the (small) handful...no kidding. Barely shreds them at all. Works much better on sticks, twigs, and other plant materials. If it didn't do such a good job with the small limbs and sticks, I'd have returned it. Very quiet. Easy to assemble.
customer_reviews.author: Max M. Houck

customer_reviews.title: Light Duty Only
customer_reviews.text: It will do light duty chipping but it takes too long to get much of anything done. If you want to do a little clean-up here and there, now and then, it may be okay. After working with it for about 6 hours, I bought a gas powered one, put this away and never used it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Be sure your extension cord fits this Input wiring
customer_reviews.text: I haven't used this device yet so am withholding my review; one thing out of my 3 extension cords, only one fit the antiquated 2 prong recessed input connection.............
customer_reviews.author: Hal M. Kilbourne

customer_reviews.title: For the Money  it is Good
customer_reviews.text: We had a heavy duty gas chipper for many years and got rid of it during a move. This machine does not chip/shred as well has the much more expensive gas unit, but for what we need it works pretty well. It does not crunch everything down as fine as I would like, but we can get small branches and twigs down to a more manageable size.
customer_reviews.author: LivingtheDream2255

customer_reviews.title: runs well
customer_reviews.text: Not a disappointment. I have used it to mulch up a lot of branches and it has held up well. Get an extra set of blades so after you use both sides you can take it out and replace it while you find time to sharpen the first one.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: This for the price is awesome cuts like butter easy to use I have pic ...
customer_reviews.text: This for the price is awesome cuts like butter easy to use I have pic that I will load and submit once I complete the pile of branches I had pile up so far the blade is cutting fine and I haven't had too flip it yet or use the extra one I had got when I order this if you have trees in your yard and branches are a problem this can handle them
customer_reviews.author: Rudy Martin

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Sent this back..clogs quickly with green leaves and shrub and takes forever. Not enough power for dry twigs..Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: LAWRENCE  LINTNER

customer_reviews.title: The smaller parts of the branches got sucked through in long pieces without getting chipped
customer_reviews.text: Got here quick. Set it up asnd ran some small branches through. The smaller parts of the branches got sucked through in long pieces without getting chipped. The thicker stuff seemed to get chipped for the most part but not consistently. Chipping leave...forget it. plants and weeds etc. get sucked through without getting too much damage.
customer_reviews.author: dave b.

customer_reviews.title: The branches can't be too large and it's better if the branches have dried out a bit
customer_reviews.text: It's important to keep the blade sharp. The branches can't be too large and it's better if the branches have dried out a bit. I do like that I can chop up things I trim and get them to fit in ONE garbage bag.
customer_reviews.author: E. Rasmussen

customer_reviews.title: Overall did a nice job.
customer_reviews.text: Gave this thing a work out when it first arrived. It did what I needed. Word of caution, wear gloves as it can kick sticks back towards your hand. Patience is required as you cannot feed high volume through it at once. Overall did a nice job.
customer_reviews.author: G. Cacciatore

customer_reviews.title: does better when plant is wet
customer_reviews.text: very impressed. bought this to make chum for offshore. after i filet trout i run them threw this and it can only do about a 20" trout. does well. but thats about it then i hose it down. impressed it last this long. done some twigs only handles only one inch. does better when plant is wet. drier thicker twigs are harder.
customer_reviews.author: Malachi Oxford

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised, quiet, effective, time-saving.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble, quiet, and effective! It's only designed to shred sticks. Branches with leaves tend to plug it up. However it's very easy to remove the chute cover and clear it. Will save a lot of work and frustration if it lasts. It also works fine on a 15 amp outlet, so far.
customer_reviews.author: PaulTD

customer_reviews.title: Truly useful in the yard
customer_reviews.text: Where I live things grow fast in their season. There always seems to be something to trim. This device makes recycling very easy. It really can handle up to about an inch and a half. I was favorably impressed after using something I was somewhat hesitant to purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Reluctant Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: went fine. Delivery good
customer_reviews.text: Assembled product; went fine. Delivery good. Haven't used yet, because Spring winds are still blowing.
customer_reviews.author: Kathryn Bretz

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not quite as good as advertised, but did a pretty good job on yard clean-up.
customer_reviews.author: rick

customer_reviews.title: Wimpy, but works for light trimming.
customer_reviews.text: OK, but pretty wimpy. No way it will handle anything over 1" unless it is balsa wood. And it easily jams with small stuff, ~1/2" especially if it hasn't dried for a few months first.
customer_reviews.author: James Hemingway

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Cleared out about 1/2 acre of new growth, used the chipper to dispose of all the new growth popular trees that spring up every year. Did up to 1 1/2 inch, had to open it up a couple times to clear the blade but I kind of expected that with the work load. I'd buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Works, but very slow. To keep it going ...
customer_reviews.text: Works, but very slow. To keep it going, you really can not shred more than a small handful of twigs at a time.
customer_reviews.author: Peter H.

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm rather disappointed with this chipper shredder. It works okay on small rigid branches, but just about everything else I have tried plugs up the chute, requiring frequent stops to clear the chute. Forget using it on anything wet or fibrous.
customer_reviews.author: C. Allen

customer_reviews.title: Lawnmaster wood chipper
customer_reviews.text: Not as powferful as I hoped, it took too long to chip the small limbs
customer_reviews.author: mary f.

customer_reviews.title: works fine for small branches but if you try to stick ...
customer_reviews.text: works fine for small branches but if you try to stick anything in there around three quarters to an inch it struggles
customer_reviews.author: Bobby

customer_reviews.title: Works for us!
customer_reviews.text: We used it through the season and did not have trouble with it. We stuck with the size it's supposed to handle, and my husband was able to save the cedar chips for me. We'll be using it at next pruning.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa M. B.

customer_reviews.title: Good for yard cleanups
customer_reviews.text: Very effective for fresh cuttings - struggles with really dry pieces - very helpful in reducing the volume of my yard cleanups - I've only had one jam which wasn't that hard to clear
customer_reviews.author: LDP - Denver

customer_reviews.title: Did what I needed it to
customer_reviews.text: This is not a heavy duty chipper but works great for backyard debris and small branches that fall. I used it to chip a bunch of overgrown laurel and was able to finish the job in 3 hours (way less time than I expected). It made it easy to get rid of a lot of debris without having to fill a lot of recycle cans (only one needed).
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Pfaltzgraff

customer_reviews.title: ok to use
customer_reviews.text: it does not chip branches, peels more because the disc is angled. I am used to a horizontal disk, chipping the branches into small pieces. Input is small, takes time to feed it with leaves but they were chipped
customer_reviews.author: HD

customer_reviews.title: Good light weight machine for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It does the job for branches bigger than 1/4 inch and less then 1 and 1/2 inch. Don't ask for anything else. Very small twigs tend to get clogged in the output chute because they don't get shredded. But as long as I cleared them out often it wouldn't jam up and I could keep the branches going in. This is nothing like a real chipper but it did make a pile of mulch out of my hedge trimmings.
customer_reviews.author: TB12 GOAT

customer_reviews.title: On the first day it worked great. We used it for an hour and it ...
customer_reviews.text: On the first day it worked great. We used it for an hour and it worked as expected. On the second day we couldn't get it started. We followed the troubleshooting tips in the manual and still it wouldn't work. We ended up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Did everything I bought it for!
customer_reviews.text: I bought the LawnMaster chipper because I had several branches of trees go down this past winter and needed to get rid of the mess.I knew I wasn't going to be chipping up the 2 1/2 to 3 inch branches and simply used it to chip all the branches under1 1/2 inches which was an easy task but was a lot of branches. Only jammed on me once when I tried shoving two 1 1/2 branches into it at once and took seconds to unjam. Totally satisfied with my purchase and will get plenty of use out of it I am sure.
customer_reviews.author: Donald J C Freeman

customer_reviews.title: Worked as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Very happy! This little unit worked great. NO, it won't handle anything much over 1.5" but I knew that going in. It did turn a large pile of broken limbs into one garbage bag of waste. Small so it doesn't take up much room in the shed. I think you might even be able to hang it. Electric, so the two time a year that it gets used I won't be fighting another hard starting gas engine. I highly recommend this unit to the home owner that has smaller trees and yard waste. The kind that are a pain to cut up small enough for the garbage truck.
customer_reviews.author: M. Coalson

customer_reviews.title: twighs gone
customer_reviews.text: Good producr have mulched several piles of small twighs. Safe works well well occ. Jam easy to clean out
customer_reviews.author: Denese

customer_reviews.title: but great for straight
customer_reviews.text: its about what I expected. definitely not a heavy duty device, but great for straight, long branches under 1 1/2". It is great for Japanese ligustrum which has long straight shoots that requiring annual trimming
customer_reviews.author: jah

product_meta.title: LawnMaster FD1501 Electric Chipper Shredder
product_meta.description: Turn unwanted yard waste into nutrient-rich mulch with this electric chipper shredder. Powerful 15-amp motor and large 1-1/2-inch cutting diameter produces mulch at a ratio of 10:1. 8-inch wheels make this unit easily mobile, and included collection bag lets you transport your mulch from the machine itself. Push stick helps fit branches and sticks into the shredder, and "peace of mind" overload protector ensures you don't overload the machine. This electric chipper shredder provides a green, clean and efficient alternative to gas-powered shredders. This machine is not intended for use for leaves or bamboo.
feature_bullets: 10: 1 MULCH RATIO: With collection bag to easily transport your mulch
MAINTENANCE FREE: No gas! No Oil! No need to charge a battery.

1 1/2-INCH MAX CUTTING DIAMETER: Max branch thickness that can be chipped is dependent on the wood type and quality, but never thicker than 1 1/2 inches. For hardwood (e. g. oak/beech), or knotted wood, the max branch cutting capacity is less than it is for soft wood (e. g. pine/spruce). Not intended for bamboo.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.6 out of 5 stars398 ratings3.6 out of 5 stars
